intro: Takulumena kuelapense, commonly known as the Kuelapensis tree, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest of Peru. It is a tall, evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 30 meters, with a broad canopy that provides shade to the forest floor. The tree has dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and yellowish-white, typically appearing in clusters during the wet season. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, elliptical seeds.
